references.reason: This paper is the benchmark dataset used for the study, providing a large-scale dataset for comprehensive evaluation of transfer learning in volumetric medical image segmentation.

references.paper_title: nnU-Net: a self-configuring method for deep learning-based biomedical image segmentation
references.reason: This paper introduced nnU-Net, a task-specific baseline used for comparison in the study, allowing for evaluating the performance of the model in diverse tasks.

references.paper_title: STU-Net: Scalable and Transferable U-Net for Medical Image Segmentation
references.reason: This paper presented STU-Net, the main model used in the study, a flexible and scalable model that allows for evaluating transfer learning across modalities and targets.

references.paper_title: TotalSegmentator: Robust segmentation of 104 anatomic structures in CT images
references.reason: This paper introduced TotalSegmentator, a large-scale full-body CT dataset that served as the foundation for pre-training the models in the study.

references.paper_title: The multimodal Brain Tumor Image Segmentation Benchmark (BRATS)
references.reason: This paper is frequently cited and represents a widely used benchmark dataset in medical image segmentation, providing a standard for evaluating model performance.
